byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

abstract: Review of internal reports, log books and video from Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, NY, as well as witness accounts, offer insight into 2010 death of inmate Leonard Strickland; Strickland's death is often cited by prisoners as example of savage beatings guards sometimes inflict on prisoners; circumstances surrounding his death would likely have remained unknown had it not been for attention paid to prison in wake of June escape by two murderers.
lead_paragraph: The 2010 death of Leonard Strickland would have probably been forgotten by all but the officers and inmates at Clinton Correctional Facility. Then a breakout brought attention to the prison’s secrets.

headline.main: An Inmate Dies, and No One Is Punished
headline.print_headline: A New York Inmate Dies, and No One Is Punished

snippet: The 2010 death of Leonard Strickland would have probably been forgotten by all but the officers and inmates at Clinton Correctional Facility. Then a breakout brought attention to the prison’s secrets.
